message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. Given its high value and quality, I believe it's worth more than $100. Considering its worth to you is $150, I propose we start negotiations at $120. Let me know if this works for you.

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $110. I'm willing to pay a premium, but I'm not sure I can go as high as $120. Can you meet me in the middle at $110?

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and am willing to consider it. In light of our current discussion, I propose we move forward at $115 for the product. This still maintains a reasonable profit margin for me while acknowledging your valuation of the item.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above $100. I'm willing to pay $108 for the product. Can you meet me at this price?

I see where you're coming from, Bob. Considering our previous discussions and your valuation of the product, I'm willing to agree on a price of $109 for the product. This allows for a fair compromise between our positions.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above $100. I'm willing to pay $106 for the product. Can you meet me at this price?

Thank you for your patience and understanding, Bob. After considering our previous offers, I am willing to agree on a price of $107 for the product. This price allows for a fair compromise and maintains a reasonable profit margin for me.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still trying to get as close to my valuation as possible. I'm willing to pay $105 for the product. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand your position, Bob. After careful consideration, I am willing to agree on a price of $106 for the product. This price reflects a fair compromise and maintains a reasonable profit margin for me.
I'm willing to meet you at $104 for the product. This is my final offer. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to explore other options.
